1_executive_summary.purpose: Implement a custom menu bar (File, Settings, Help) that replaces the OS title bar, creating a frameless window experience with integrated window controls (minimize, maximize, close) in the menu bar for a modern, unified desktop application interface.
1_executive_summary.value_proposition: Provides a cleaner, more integrated desktop app experience by removing the default OS title bar, consolidates window controls and application menus in one unified bar, matches modern app design patterns (VS Code, Discord, Slack), and improves visual consistency across platforms.
1_executive_summary.real_world_analogy: Like VS Code or Discord - the top bar combines the application menus (File, Edit, View) with window controls (minimize, maximize, close) all in one seamless bar, without the separate OS title bar taking up space.
1_executive_summary.use_case: User launches app → frameless window opens with custom menu bar at top → menu bar shows File, Settings, Help menus on left, window controls (minimize, maximize, close) on right → user can drag window by clicking and dragging the menu bar area → clicking window controls minimizes/maximizes/closes window → clicking File menu shows Exit option.
1_executive_summary.output: Modified shell/main.js with frameless window configuration, new IPC handlers for window controls, updated preload.js with window control APIs, new MenuBar component with File/Settings/Help menus and window controls, draggable menu bar area, browser-compatible implementation.

threats: Window dragging could be exploited if not properly scoped
security.mitigation: Only allow dragging on menu bar area, not on interactive elements

breaking_changes.reason: Changes window appearance and behavior - users will need to adapt to new interface, but functionality remains the same

mitigation_strategies: Test frameless window on all target platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux)
Ensure window controls work correctly in all window states (normal, maximized, minimized)
Implement proper drag region to prevent accidental window movement
Graceful degradation in browser environment (hide window controls)
Test window state persistence across app restarts

3_current_state_analysis.architecture_context: Operates at Electron main process (window configuration) and React presentation layer (menu bar UI). Frameless window configuration happens in Electron main process (main.js). Window controls communicate via IPC from renderer to main process. Menu bar component integrates into Header/root layout. Must handle both Electron (with IPC) and browser (graceful degradation) environments. Menu bar must be draggable for window movement when title bar is removed.

primary_features: Frameless window configuration in Electron (frame: false in BrowserWindow)
Custom menu bar with File, Settings, Help menus positioned at top of window
Window controls (minimize, maximize/fullscreen, close) integrated into menu bar on right side
Menu bar draggable area for window movement (when title bar is removed)
File menu with Exit/Quit option (closes app in Electron, shows message in browser)
Settings menu (placeholder for future settings panel)
Help menu with Open All LLMs, Keyboard Shortcuts, and About options
secondary_features: Window controls styled to match OS conventions (Windows, Mac, Linux)
Window maximize/restore state tracking and icon updates
Menu bar styling matches application theme (light/dark mode support)
Keyboard navigation support for menus (Alt key to focus, arrow keys to navigate)
Menu dropdowns close on outside click or Escape key
Window controls disabled/hidden in browser environment
edge_case_handling: Handle window state changes (maximize/restore) and update maximize button icon accordingly
Handle rapid window control clicks (prevent double-clicks from causing issues)
Handle menu bar drag when window is maximized (prevent accidental restore)
Handle browser environment where window controls are not applicable (hide or disable)
Handle Electron API unavailable (graceful degradation, show message or hide controls)
configuration_options: Optional: Configuration to show/hide specific menu items
Optional: Configuration to customize window control button styling per OS
